title: CPAP Suboptimal Environment Alert
description: Alerts clinician when high bedroom CO₂ or poor air quality may be affecting CPAP therapy effectiveness.

cards.summary: ⚠️ High bedroom CO₂ may be affecting CPAP therapy
cards.detail:
Patient has good CPAP adherence and appropriate pressure, but bedroom CO₂ is very high (2100 ppm avg) with low HRV (45 ms). High CO₂ can cause central sleep apnea independent of CPAP settings.

Recommendation: Address environmental factors before adjusting CPAP pressure.

actions.description: Add ventilation recommendation to care plan
